001package org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
004import org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionInput;
005import org.bitcoinj.crypto.ECKey;
006import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
007import org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutPoint;
008import org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput;
009import org.bitcoinj.crypto.DeterministicKey;
010import org.bitcoinj.script.ScriptBuilder;
011import org.bitcoinj.wallet.DeterministicKeyChain;
012
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.Optional;
015import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
016
017/**
018 * A "signing wallet"  that uses a {@link DeterministicKeyChain} to
019 * sign {@link SigningRequest}s.
020 */
021public class HDKeychainSigner implements BaseTransactionSigner {
022    private final DeterministicKeyChain keyChain;
023
024    public HDKeychainSigner(DeterministicKeyChain keyChain) {
025        this.keyChain = keyChain;
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * Create a signed bitcoinj transaction from the signing request
030     * <p>
031     * NOTE: This was an attempt to use an unsigned transaction and a list of address.
032     * It is private and should not be used. I'm leaving it here because it demonstrates
033     * the use of `duplicateDetached()` and we may want to use this elsewhere to sign
034     * incomplete bitcoinj transactions.
035     * <p>
036     * Assumes all inputs are P2PKH (for now) and addresses must be in
037     * the same order as the unsigned inputs in the unsigned transaction.
038     * 
039     * @param addresses An ordered list of funding addresses (keys must be in HD keychain)
040     * @param unsignedTx An unsigned bitcoinj transaction
041     * @return a newly created, signed bitcoinj transaction
042     */
043    private CompletableFuture<Transaction> signTransaction(List<Address> addresses, Transaction unsignedTx) {
044        if (addresses.size() != unsignedTx.getInputs().size()) {
045            throw new IllegalArgumentException("addresses and inputs must be 1:1 mapped");
046        }
047
048        // Create a new, empty bitcoinj transaction
049        Transaction tx = new Transaction();
050
051        // For each output in the signing request, add an output to the bitcoinj transaction
052        // TODO: Transaction validation
053        for (TransactionOutput output : unsignedTx.getOutputs()) {
054            tx.addOutput(output.duplicateDetached());
055        }
056
057        // For each address in the input list, add a signed input to the bitcoinj transaction
058        for (int index = 0; index < unsignedTx.getInputs().size(); index++) {
059            Address address = addresses.get(index);
060            TransactionInput input = unsignedTx.getInputs().get(index);
061            TransactionOutPoint outPoint = input.getOutpoint().disconnectOutput();
062            DeterministicKey fromKey = keyChain.findKeyFromPubHash(address.getHash());
063            tx.addSignedInput(outPoint, ScriptBuilder.createOutputScript(address), input.getValue(), fromKey);
064        }
065        return CompletableFuture.completedFuture(tx);
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Return the signing key for an input, if available
070     * @param input Transaction input data
071     * @return Signing key, if available, {@link Optional#empty()} otherwise.
072     */
073    public Optional<ECKey> keyForInput(TransactionInputData input) {
074
075        return Optional.ofNullable(
076                keyChain.findKeyFromPubHash(input.script().getPubKeyHash())
077        );
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Return the signing key for an input, if available
082     * @param pubKeyHash pubKeyHash
083     * @return Signing key, if available, {@link Optional#empty()} otherwise.
084     */
085    public Optional<ECKey> keyForHash(byte[] pubKeyHash) {
086
087        return Optional.ofNullable(
088                keyChain.findKeyFromPubHash(pubKeyHash)
089        );
090    }
091
092    public Optional<ECKey> pubKeyFromPubKeyHash(byte[] pubKeyHash) {
093        return keyForHash(pubKeyHash).map(ECKey::fromPublicOnly);
094    }
095}
